newsitem.title: USA: Activision enters flight simulation market.
newsitem.headline: Activision enters flight simulation market.

text.p: Activision Inc said it has entered into a deal to distribute three upcoming flight simulation games from Parsoft Interactive Inc, a move that marks its entry into the computer flight game segment.
Parsoft is headed by Eric Parker, developer of the award-winning "Hellcats over the Pacific" and "A-10 Attack!" -- a hit Macintosh game during 1995.
Activision said it agreed to buy the worldwide Microsoft Corp Windows 95 rights to three of Parsoft's combat simulation games.
It said it expects to ship the first title, A-10 Cuba!, the sequel to A-10 Attack!, by the Christmas holiday season.
One of the highest grossing titles for Apple Computer Inc's Macintosh platform, A-10 Attack! has sold about 80,000 units since its release last year.
The other two games, tentatively titled A-10 Gulf! and Dogfight, are slated for release in 1997.
The announcement marks Activision's foray into the flight simulation genre beyond its existing stable of action, simulation, strategy and adventure games.
